overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Properties of Powers with Zero and Negative Exponents
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students evaluate algebraic expressions with integer exponents. Students determine the sign of a negative number raised to an even or odd power. They create rules to raise any base to the zero power and rewrite negative exponents as positive exponents.

overview_item_data_items: I can explain the Properties of Powers, including Product of Powers, Quotient of Powers, Power of a Power, and Zero and Negative Exponent rules.
I can generate equivalent expressions by applying properties of integer exponents.
A negative number raised to an odd power results in a negative product, while a negative number raised to an even power results in a positive product.
The zero power of any number except 0 is 1.

You can rewrite an expression with a negative exponent in the numerator as a positive exponent in the denominator. Likewise, you can rewrite an expression with a negative exponent in the denominator as a positive exponent in the numerator.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze a number string to determine the relationship between exponents and products.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Powers Equal to 1 and Numbers Less Than 1
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students use calculations to develop a rule to raise any base to the zero power.
Students rewrite exponential expresssions with zero and negative exponents.
